result.execSummary:
The defendant Maurice Henderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

No violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause.
Do not use or possess illegally controlled substances.
AODA, treatment or program.  Random screening.
Court denies defense motion for expungement.
Court advised defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance, alcohol forfeits the release privileges.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Maurice Henderson

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeds.  Statements by counsel.  

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 12 months at the House of Correction with release privileges for the Day Reporting Program only and 3 days credit.  COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of 2 years.

CONDITIONS:  1) no violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant; 3) do not use or possess illegally controlled substances; 4) random screening; 5) AODA, treatment or program; 6) seek & maintain employment or be in rolled in a further education program; 7) perform 40 hours of community service; 8) obtain GED or HSED; 9) SERVE 30 DAYS at the House of Correction commencing by noon on 8-17-15 with work release for work and school - no good time. 

Court advises the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance, alcohol forfeits the release privileges. 

COURT ORDERS:
- defendant to provide a DNA sample. 

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration CreditSentencing Referral Form  and Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copy given to the defendant.

Court denies defense motion for expungement.

Defendant Maurice Henderson in court with attorney Glenn Edward Gaskill.  Danielle Chojnacki for Brandon Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Case heard for Br. 17.  Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.
Branch 17 in jury trial on another matter, case spun to Branch 44.

Defendant Maurice Henderson in court with attorney Glenn Edward Gaskill.  Paul Hauer on behalf of Brandon Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for projected plea and sentencing hearing. Defense request an adjournment for reason placed on the record. Any motions due on 08-11-2015 by 8:30 am. Case adjourned for projected plea and sentencing hearing on 08-11-2015 at 8:30 am, branch 17.  Parties notified that effective August 1, 2015, Branch 17 will be located in the Safety Building, room 310.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Calendar call scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Maurice Henderson in court with attorney Glenn Edward Gaskill.  Danielle Chojnacki on bahalf of Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk. 
Held off the record.  Court orders case for adjourned Plea and Sentencing, Branch 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Maurice Henderson in court with attorney Glenn Edward Gaskill.  Ronald Dague for Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Oral No Weapons Order, No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 05-12-2015 at 01:30 pm.
